about: Hello, I am Yakupha Ntonintshi.I was born and raised in a small township called Khayelitsha in Cape Town. I live with both my parents and my two brothers. I am the only girl at home. My passion for web developer started when I applied at Life Choices. I only had an IT background, where I was doing one programming language which was Delphi, which also added an impact in me loving everything about coding.

testimonials.name: Lamlankosi
testimonials.review: We were blown away by the quality of Yakupha's work. She created a website that is visually stunning, highly functional, and perfectly aligned with our brand. Her attention to detail and commitment to excellence is apparent in every aspect of her work. Yakupha is a true professional who cares deeply about their clients' success. We couldn't be happier with our new site.

testimonials.name: Khanya Pupuma
testimonials.review: From the start, Yakupha stood out for her creativity, technical proficiency, and dedication to client satisfaction. She took our ideas and turned them into a dynamic website that has significantly enhanced our online presence.

testimonials.name: Simanye Somdaka
testimonials.review: Working with Yakupha has been a game-changer for our business. Her ability to understand our vision and translate it into a functional, beautiful website was nothing short of impressive. She was responsive, professional, and incredibly detail-oriented. Our website not only looks fantastic but also performs seamlessly.

projects.description: I built this calculator using mostly javascript as it needed more functionality, then I used CSS for styling it. HTML is used as a template to display the calculator.
Ibuilt this keyboard using mostly Javascript for functioning, CSS for styling and HTML.
I had an e-commerce Javascript project whereby I decided to sell flowers. It consists of Javascript for functioning, CSS for styling and HTML as a template.
I created this BMI Calculator to keep track of my health. I used Javascript, CSS and HTML.
I made this temparature converter to test how different is kelvin to celcius.
I created this flip card using HTML, CSS and Javascript.
